result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Duane A Mcclyman was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: With huber and to commence immediately.  Sentence may be served in another county, if it can be arranged and at no additional costs to Green Lake County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:45 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vandenbranden for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and counts 2 & 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  Statement by Atty Selsing.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged (5th).  Court orders count 2 dismissed and count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 30 months.

CONDITIONS:

6 months county jail - with huber and to commence immediately and may be served in another county
$600 fine plus costs
AODA
D.L. revocation for 2 years.
IID - 2 years.
Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Statement by Atty Selsing - requests a day out to attend the funeral of his father.  Statement by the Court - defendant will need to fill out an inmate request to the court.

Court adjourned at 11:53 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-06-2015 11:00 am

10:02 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - defendant is requesting additional time to enter a plea to find transportation.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 6, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:03 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-31-2015 09:30 am

9:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing and requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled at least 30 days out as the defendant is in the process of moving.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Selsing and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Selsing enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Plea and Sentencing on August 31, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:55 a.m.
Preliminary hearing at 07-06-2015 09:00 am

9:50 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney John Selsing present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Atty Selsing regarding preliminary hearing.  Statement by Atty Selsing.  Court will set for prelim on July 6, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:51 a.m.
Status hearing at 06-01-2015 09:30 am

1:36 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - does not have Discovery as of yet and would like to set for pretrial.  Court will set for status hearing on June 1, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:38 p.m.
Status hearing at 05-05-2015 01:30 pm
Status hearing at 05-04-2015 02:15 pm
By Atty John Selsing

Peggy from Selsing's office called to let us know John has been appointed as PD to this case, but he cannot make the April 13th, 10:00 a.m. hearing date and would like it rescheduled with his office.   PD will be sending an order of appointment to us. 44
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Rhonda at GLSO.
43
Status hearing at 04-13-2015 10:00 am
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:33 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 13, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:36 p.m.

Warrant sent down to GLSO on 03/17/2015.
43

4:17 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court.  Court orders a warrant for his non-appearance - forthwith.  

Court adjourned at 4:18 p.m.
from DA's office to the defendant - does not need to appear at the court date listed on the citations
